page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
{ OSMASTON MANOR},SQUARE 04200342, WAS COMPLETED IN 1856 FOR FRANCIS WRIGHT AT A COST OF Â£80,000. IT WAS 330FT LONG BY 192FT WIDE AND SURROUNDED BY 400 ACRES OF WOODLAND.
SMOKE FROM THE MANY FIRES IN THE HOUSE WAS TAKEN THROUGH UNDERGROUND CONDUITS TO A NEAR BY SMOKE TOWER.
EARTH DAMS WERE BUILT TO CREATE LAKES. NEAR TO ONE DAM A WATER POWERED SAW MILL WAS BUILT TO CUT WOOD AND SLATE FOR THE BUILDING OF THE MANOR.
THE MANOR WAS DEMOLISHED IN 1965 AFTER BEING UNUSED FOR SOME TIME.THE SAWMILL,NOW CONVERTED TO ELECTRIC POWER,THE WALLED GARDENS AND THE SMOKE TOWER STILL EXIST TODAY.
